title: Africa Growing Together Fund provides $20 million loan for 44.8MW Malagarasi Hydropower Project (Linked to Project ID#36104)
description: On May 22, 2014, the African Development Bank (AfDB) and the People's Bank of China (PBOC) signed an agreement for Africa Growing Together Fund (AGTF) (see Umbrella Project ID#36104). The purpose of this $2 billion loan facility was to finance large development projects in Africa between 2014 and 2024. The AGTF is sponsored by the PBOC and administered by AfDB. Then, on May 26, 2021, AGTF signed a $20 million loan agreement with the Government of Tanzania for the 44.8MW Malagarasi Hydropower Project. On the same day, the African Development Bank’s Africa Development Fund (ADF) issued a $120 million loan to the Government of Tanzania for the same project. The borrowing terms of the AGTF loan and the ADB loan were as follows: a 24-year maturity, a 5-year grace period, an interest rate of 6-month LIBOR plus a 0.9% margin, a 0.25% commitment fee, and a 0.25% management fee.   The project involves the construction of a 44.8MW hydropower plant in Western Tanzania that will provide reliable renewable energy to households, schools, clinics, and small and medium-sized enterprises in the Kigoma Region. The power plant will be located on the Malagarasi River, west of the Malagarasi swamps, in the area called Igamba. The project site (exact locational coordinates: -5.178611, 30.063611) will be located at Igamba Falls. This location lies approximately 100 kilometers (62 mi), by road, southeast of the regional capital of Kigoma. The project has four components. Component A (construction of Malagarasi hydropower plant) consists of (i) civil works comprising earth and concrete works including powerhouse, gravity dam, diversion works, and switchyard as well as access roads/bridges and permanent camps together with offices and staff accommodation, dispensary & primary school facilities;  (ii) electro-mechanical works comprising supply, installation, testing, and commissioning of turbines, synchronous generators, step-up transformers, associated sending-ends switchgear and balance of plant including hydraulic steel structures;  and  (iii)  tree planting as part of the livelihood restoration and community development as well as climate change mitigation measures. Component B (construction of an evacuation transmission line) involves the supply, installation, testing, and commissioning of a 54 km single-circuit  132  kV transmission line from  Malagarasi  10.5/132  kV power plant station to interface with the national grid at the proposed EDCF-funded Kidahwe 400/132/33 kV substation. Component C (construction of distribution networks and rural electrification lines including installation of last-mile connections) involves 33 kV medium voltage (MV) grid extensions of  40  km, low voltage  (LV)  reticulations of  65  km, installation of  15  new distribution transformers to serve,  among others,  communities living within the neighborhood of the power plant and transmission line route environs as well as increasing the 33  kV energy dispatch capacity from  Kidahwe  400/132/33  kV substation. This will also include the supply of no-pole 4,250 customer connection materials (to clear TANESCO’s application backlogs in Kigoma, Kibondo, and Kasulu load centers) as well as 1,000 ready-boards for low-income households.    These connections will be inclusive of at-least  4  dispensaries  (with antenatal or maternal facilities)  and  6  primary schools under the livelihood restoration program in Uvinza District. Component D (project management and contract) involves (i) consultancy services for project management and supervision of works for  Malagarasi  HPP, distribution network expansion  &  rural electrification including installation of last-mile connections; (ii)  institutional support for sustainable management and development of hydropower resources; and (iii) annual  Project audits comprising financial  & technical, procurement and environmental & social compliance. Component E (compensation and/or resettlement) involves compensation and/or resettlement of project-affected persons (PAPs). Upon completion, it is expected that the hydropower plant will generate an average annual output of 181 GWh and meet the electricity needs of as many as 133,649 Kigoma households, bringing the region’s electrification rate more closely in line with the rest of the country.
staff_comments: 1. The AfDB project identification number is P-TZ-FAB-004. 2. The project’s economic rate of return is estimated at 17.56%. 3. The all-in interest rate (1.086%) was calculated by adding an 0.9% margin to the average 6-month LIBOR rate in May 2021 (0.186%). 4. The margin of 0.9% is calculated by adding the Funding Cost Margin (unknown) to the Lending Margin (0.8%) and the Maturity Premium (0.10%)
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title
Africa Growing Together Fund provides $20 million loan for 44.8MW Malagarasi Hydropower Project (Linked to Project ID#36104)

# Description
On May 22, 2014, the African Development Bank (AfDB) and the People's Bank of China (PBOC) signed an agreement for Africa Growing Together Fund (AGTF) (see Umbrella Project ID#36104). The purpose of this $2 billion loan facility was to finance large development projects in Africa between 2014 and 2024. The AGTF is sponsored by the PBOC and administered by AfDB. Then, on May 26, 2021, AGTF signed a $20 million loan agreement with the Government of Tanzania for the 44.8MW Malagarasi Hydropower Project. On the same day, the African Development Bank’s Africa Development Fund (ADF) issued a $120 million loan to the Government of Tanzania for the same project. The borrowing terms of the AGTF loan and the ADB loan were as follows: a 24-year maturity, a 5-year grace period, an interest rate of 6-month LIBOR plus a 0.9% margin, a 0.25% commitment fee, and a 0.25% management fee.   The project involves the construction of a 44.8MW hydropower plant in Western Tanzania that will provide reliable renewable energy to households, schools, clinics, and small and medium-sized enterprises in the Kigoma Region. The power plant will be located on the Malagarasi River, west of the Malagarasi swamps, in the area called Igamba. The project site (exact locational coordinates: -5.178611, 30.063611) will be located at Igamba Falls. This location lies approximately 100 kilometers (62 mi), by road, southeast of the regional capital of Kigoma. The project has four components. Component A (construction of Malagarasi hydropower plant) consists of (i) civil works comprising earth and concrete works including powerhouse, gravity dam, diversion works, and switchyard as well as access roads/bridges and permanent camps together with offices and staff accommodation, dispensary & primary school facilities;  (ii) electro-mechanical works comprising supply, installation, testing, and commissioning of turbines, synchronous generators, step-up transformers, associated sending-ends switchgear and balance of plant including hydraulic steel structures;  and  (iii)  tree planting as part of the livelihood restoration and community development as well as climate change mitigation measures. Component B (construction of an evacuation transmission line) involves the supply, installation, testing, and commissioning of a 54 km single-circuit  132  kV transmission line from  Malagarasi  10.5/132  kV power plant station to interface with the national grid at the proposed EDCF-funded Kidahwe 400/132/33 kV substation. Component C (construction of distribution networks and rural electrification lines including installation of last-mile connections) involves 33 kV medium voltage (MV) grid extensions of  40  km, low voltage  (LV)  reticulations of  65  km, installation of  15  new distribution transformers to serve,  among others,  communities living within the neighborhood of the power plant and transmission line route environs as well as increasing the 33  kV energy dispatch capacity from  Kidahwe  400/132/33  kV substation. This will also include the supply of no-pole 4,250 customer connection materials (to clear TANESCO’s application backlogs in Kigoma, Kibondo, and Kasulu load centers) as well as 1,000 ready-boards for low-income households.    These connections will be inclusive of at-least  4  dispensaries  (with antenatal or maternal facilities)  and  6  primary schools under the livelihood restoration program in Uvinza District. Component D (project management and contract) involves (i) consultancy services for project management and supervision of works for  Malagarasi  HPP, distribution network expansion  &  rural electrification including installation of last-mile connections; (ii)  institutional support for sustainable management and development of hydropower resources; and (iii) annual  Project audits comprising financial  & technical, procurement and environmental & social compliance. Component E (compensation and/or resettlement) involves compensation and/or resettlement of project-affected persons (PAPs). Upon completion, it is expected that the hydropower plant will generate an average annual output of 181 GWh and meet the electricity needs of as many as 133,649 Kigoma households, bringing the region’s electrification rate more closely in line with the rest of the country.
justification: Primary purpose is renewable energy generation through hydropower, with clear environmental and social benefits
evidence: 44.8MW hydropower plant, renewable energy focus, tree planting for climate change mitigation, rural electrification benefits

title: Chinese Government donates RMB 1 Million to support the Training Centre in procurement of fishing materials and equipment of Tanzania in January 2021
description: From January 7-8 2021, H.E. Wang Yi met with Tanzanian President John Magufuli. During this visit, H.E. Wang Yi attended the inauguration ceremony of Chato District Vocational Training Centre. On behalf of the Chinese Government, handed over the donation of RMB 1 million yuan (around US$154,000) to support the Training Centre in the procurement of fishing materials and equipment.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Chinese Government donates RMB 1 Million to support the Training Centre in procurement of fishing materials and equipment of Tanzania in January 2021

# Description
From January 7-8 2021, H.E. Wang Yi met with Tanzanian President John Magufuli. During this visit, H.E. Wang Yi attended the inauguration ceremony of Chato District Vocational Training Centre. On behalf of the Chinese Government, handed over the donation of RMB 1 million yuan (around US$154,000) to support the Training Centre in the procurement of fishing materials and equipment.
justification: Project focuses on social development through vocational training and fishing equipment procurement, with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation for vocational training center, procurement of fishing materials and equipment

title: Chinese Government donates 1.065 million Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine doses worth $19.1 million in October 2021
description: In 2021 and 2022, the Chinese Government donated approximately 5.565 million doses of Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Tanzania. The Chinese Government delivered 3 million donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Tanzania on July 14, 2021. Two weeks later, on July 31, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered a batch of Sinovac COVID-19 vaccine doses and syringes to Tanzania’s Zanzibar Revolutionary Government.  The number of vaccine doses and syringes that were donated is unknown. Zanzibar Trade and Industrial Development Minister Omar Shaban and Chinese Consul General in Zanzibar Zhang Zhisheng went to the airport to greet and attend the handover ceremony. The Chinese Government delivered an additional 1,065,500 donated Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine doses to the Government of Tanzania on October 8, 2021. The package arrived at the Julius Nyerere International Airport in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. The Tanzanian government held a grand welcoming ceremony at Julius Nyerere International Airport on the same day. Minister Counselor Xu Chen of the Chinese Embassy in Tanzania, Minister of Health Guajima of Tanzania, Permanent Secretary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs Sokoyne of Tanzania and other government officials, UN Resident Coordinator Milisik, heads of diplomatic missions in Tanzania and diplomatic envoys from many countries in Tanzania attended the event. Then, on November 1, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered 500,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Tanzania. A handover ceremony took place in Dar es Salaam at the Julius Nyerere Airport. Chinese Ambassador Chen Mingjian, Minister of Health Dr. Guajima, Permanent Secretary of the Ministry of Health of Tanzania Macubi, Permanent Secretary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Tanzania Sokoin attended the ceremony. activities and speeches. Several month later, on January 26, 2022, the Chinese Government delivered 800,000 donated Sinopharm vaccine doses to the Government of Tanzania. Two days later, on January 28, 2022, the Chinese Government delivered 200,000 donated Sinovac COVID-19 doses to Tanzania’s Zanzibar Revolutionary Government. The vaccines were handed over to a Representative of the Zanzibar Revolutionary Government, Minister for Education and Vocational Training Simai Mohammed Said, by the Chinese Consul General in Zanzibar Zhang Zhisheng at the Abeid Amani Karume International Airport.
staff_comments: 1. According to the UNICEF COVID-19 Vaccine Market Dashboard, the price of a single Sinopharm/Sinovac COVID-19 vaccine dose is $18 (https://www.oecd.org/officialdocuments/publicdisplaydocumentpdf/?cote=DCD/DAC/STAT(2022)33&docLanguage=En). As such, AidData has estimated the monetary value of the October 2021 donation as $19,179,000.
combined_text:

title: China donates sewing machines to Tanzanian Government in December 2021
description: In December 2021, Ambassador Chen Mingjian and Tanzanian Minister of Education, Science and Technology Joyce Ndalichako jointly signed the donation certificate for the donation of sewing machines by the Chinese Embassy in Tanzania to Kasulu, a poor area in Kigoma Province, a remote province of Tanzania. Cultural Counselor Wang Siping participated. These sewing machines will be used to promote labor and jobs in Tanzania. Specifically, this donation will be used to set up small garment factories in 15 poor rural areas in Kasulu, which will solve more than 300 jobs, increase the income of local women and youth groups, improve their family life and enhance their social status
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
China donates sewing machines to Tanzanian Government in December 2021

# Description
In December 2021, Ambassador Chen Mingjian and Tanzanian Minister of Education, Science and Technology Joyce Ndalichako jointly signed the donation certificate for the donation of sewing machines by the Chinese Embassy in Tanzania to Kasulu, a poor area in Kigoma Province, a remote province of Tanzania. Cultural Counselor Wang Siping participated. These sewing machines will be used to promote labor and jobs in Tanzania. Specifically, this donation will be used to set up small garment factories in 15 poor rural areas in Kasulu, which will solve more than 300 jobs, increase the income of local women and youth groups, improve their family life and enhance their social status
justification: Project focuses on social development through job creation and poverty alleviation without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of sewing machines for small garment factories, job creation focus, poverty alleviation in rural areas

title: China donates a batch of medical supplies to Tanzania in September 2021
description: On September 1st, 2021, Chian donated a batch of epidemic prevention materials to Tanzania as the third wave of the epidemic hits Tanzania. The handover of materials was done at the China Assistance Center in Tanzania. The purpose of this donation is to help Tanzania fight against the pandemic. This batch of donation includes masks and medicines.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China donates a batch of medical supplies to Tanzania in September 2021

# Description
On September 1st, 2021, Chian donated a batch of epidemic prevention materials to Tanzania as the third wave of the epidemic hits Tanzania. The handover of materials was done at the China Assistance Center in Tanzania. The purpose of this donation is to help Tanzania fight against the pandemic. This batch of donation includes masks and medicines.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare support with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of medical supplies, focus on pandemic response

title: Chinese Government donated fishing equipment to the Tanchato Vocational Education and Training Center in Tanzania in May 2021
description: On May 25th 2021, Chinese Ambassador to Tanzania Wang Ke attended the material handover ceremony in Dar es Salaam and officially donated a batch of fishing equipment to Tanchato Vocational Education and Training Center. Minister of Education and Technology Ndali Chako of Tanzania, Maduku, Chairman of the Vocational Education and Training Administration, and Yang Zhiyu, Political Counselor of the Chinese Embassy in Tanzania, attended the ceremony. The purpose of this donation is to improve the level of professional skills training in local fishing and fish processing in the training center.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Chinese Government donated fishing equipment to the Tanchato Vocational Education and Training Center in Tanzania in May 2021

# Description
On May 25th 2021, Chinese Ambassador to Tanzania Wang Ke attended the material handover ceremony in Dar es Salaam and officially donated a batch of fishing equipment to Tanchato Vocational Education and Training Center. Minister of Education and Technology Ndali Chako of Tanzania, Maduku, Chairman of the Vocational Education and Training Administration, and Yang Zhiyu, Political Counselor of the Chinese Embassy in Tanzania, attended the ceremony. The purpose of this donation is to improve the level of professional skills training in local fishing and fish processing in the training center.
justification: Project focuses on vocational training and skill development without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of fishing equipment for vocational education and training center, focus on skill development

title: Chinese Government dispatches 31st medical assistance team to Tanzania in September 2021
description: On September 21st, 2021, the 31st medical team from China arrived at the Mnazi Mmoja Hospital and Abdulla Mzee Hospital on Pemba Island. On October 15, 2021, the team visited the minister of Health of Tanzania. The purpose of sending this assistance team is to support the management of difficult medical issues in Tanzania.  The 31st medical team completed its mission in September 2022. On September 10th, 2022, President Mwini of Tanzania awarded medals and commemorative certificates to all the team members in recognition of their contributions. During the medical team's time in Tanzania,  they completed about 25,000 outpatient visits, 13,000 inpatient visits, 3,213 elective and emergency surgeries, 513 critically ill patients, 3,458 acupuncture visits, 750 anesthesia visits, X-ray , MRI, CT examination about 6,000 person-times, 645 person-times of gastrointestinal endoscopy, 374 times of Helicobacter pylori detection; more than 150 times of various types of teaching activities were carried out, and about 720 local doctors were trained; 25 times of public health education were carried out, with 548 participants; public health prevention and control was carried out 5 times, and more than 70 people participated; 10 free clinics were held, benefiting 1,500 people.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government dispatches 31st medical assistance team to Tanzania in September 2021

# Description
On September 21st, 2021, the 31st medical team from China arrived at the Mnazi Mmoja Hospital and Abdulla Mzee Hospital on Pemba Island. On October 15, 2021, the team visited the minister of Health of Tanzania. The purpose of sending this assistance team is to support the management of difficult medical issues in Tanzania.  The 31st medical team completed its mission in September 2022. On September 10th, 2022, President Mwini of Tanzania awarded medals and commemorative certificates to all the team members in recognition of their contributions. During the medical team's time in Tanzania,  they completed about 25,000 outpatient visits, 13,000 inpatient visits, 3,213 elective and emergency surgeries, 513 critically ill patients, 3,458 acupuncture visits, 750 anesthesia visits, X-ray , MRI, CT examination about 6,000 person-times, 645 person-times of gastrointestinal endoscopy, 374 times of Helicobacter pylori detection; more than 150 times of various types of teaching activities were carried out, and about 720 local doctors were trained; 25 times of public health education were carried out, with 548 participants; public health prevention and control was carried out 5 times, and more than 70 people participated; 10 free clinics were held, benefiting 1,500 people.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare assistance and training without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Medical team providing healthcare services, training local doctors, and conducting public health education

title: National Health Commission of China and the Jiangsu Provincial Health Commission hand over medical equipment worth TSh120 million to Tanzania in August 2021
description: On August 16th, 2021, the National Health Commission of China and the Jiangsu Provincial Health Commission handed over medical supplies and equipment to the Mnazi Mmoja Hospital in Tanzania. The donation was worth 120 Million Tanzania Shillings. This donation will be used in Mnazi Mmoja Hospital and Abdulla Mzee Hospital, where the Chinese medical team is located, and will be used to support treating patients.

The package arrived at the Julius Nyerere International Airport in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. The Tanzanian government held a grand welcoming ceremony at Julius Nyerere International Airport on the same day. Minister Counselor Xu Chen of the Chinese Embassy in Tanzania, Minister of Health Guajima of Tanzania, Permanent Secretary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs Sokoyne of Tanzania and other government officials, UN Resident Coordinator Milisik, heads of diplomatic missions in Tanzania and diplomatic envoys from many countries in Tanzania attended the event. Then, on November 1, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered 500,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Tanzania. A handover ceremony took place in Dar es Salaam at the Julius Nyerere Airport. Chinese Ambassador Chen Mingjian, Minister of Health Dr. Guajima, Permanent Secretary of the Ministry of Health of Tanzania Macubi, Permanent Secretary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Tanzania Sokoin attended the ceremony. activities and speeches. Several month later, on January 26, 2022, the Chinese Government delivered 800,000 donated Sinopharm vaccine doses to the Government of Tanzania. Two days later, on January 28, 2022, the Chinese Government delivered 200,000 donated Sinovac COVID-19 doses to Tanzania’s Zanzibar Revolutionary Government. The vaccines were handed over to a Representative of the Zanzibar Revolutionary Government, Minister for Education and Vocational Training Simai Mohammed Said, by the Chinese Consul General in Zanzibar Zhang Zhisheng at the Abeid Amani Karume International Airport.
justification: Project involves donation of vaccines and medical supplies, which is unrelated to energy or environmental impact
evidence: Donation of Sinovac COVID-19 vaccine doses and syringes, healthcare sector focus
